entries.title: CDC: Possible safety issue with Pfizer's updated Covid vaccine, but still get it
entries.description: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said Friday that there is a possible safety issue with the bivalent Covid-19 vaccine made by Pfizer and BioNTech but that it is unlikely to represent a true risk. The agency said it continues to recommend that people stay up-to-date with Covid-19 vaccines.

entries.title: A hairline crack became a 3-foot chasm. That's when he knew they had to leave
Hear an Iranian soccer player beg for help from prison in audio obtained by CNN
entries.description: CNN obtains audio from Amir Nasr-Azadani, a high-profile Iranian footballer who is facing 26-years in prison in connection to protests that swept the country following the death of Mahsa Amini. Nasr-Azadani is not the only Iranian athlete arrested as a result of the protests. CNN's Don Riddell reports.

entries.title: Russian agency clears Olympic figure skater in its review of doping scandal
entries.description: The Russian Anti-Doping Agency (RUSADA) found figure skater Kamila Valieva violated anti-doping rules but bore no "fault or negligence" for the transgression, according to the World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA).

entries.title: Just how bad was the war in Ukraine for Europe's biggest economy last year?
entries.description: Germany's economy grew slightly last year despite battling an energy crisis sparked by Russia's war in Ukraine.

entries.title: Steve Bannon must find new lawyers to advise him in 'We Build the Wall' criminal fraud case
entries.description: A New York judge has given Steve Bannon until the end of February to find new lawyers to advise him in a criminal fraud case after the former Donald Trump aide's attorney said there were "irreconcilable differences" and communications have broken down.

entries.title: Aid chief lays blame for women bans at Taliban supreme leader's feet
entries.description: Jan Egeland, Secretary General of the Norwegian Refugee Council talks about meeting with the Taliban in an attempt to reverse the ban on women working for aid groups.

entries.title: Yellen warns 'extraordinary measures' needed to keep US from defaulting on debt as soon as next week
entries.description: The Treasury Department said Friday the US will reach the debt limit on January 19 -- months before other estimates projected -- and "extraordinary measures" will need to be taken, setting up one of the first major battles on Capitol Hill after Republicans took control of the House.

entries.title: Manchester City star found not guilty of six counts of rape
entries.description: Manchester City football player Benjamin Mendy was found not guilty of six counts of rape and one count of sexual assault at Chester Crown Court, an official from Chester Crown Court confirmed to CNN.

entries.title: Putin gets angry and berates Russian official in public meeting
entries.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin sharply criticized one of his top officials at a public meeting for not delivering military aircraft quick enough. CNN's Clarissa Ward discusses the exchange and what Putin was trying to achieve.

entries.title: US hostage envoy quietly traveled to Venezuela to see detained Americans
entries.description: The US State Department's top official for hostage and detainee issues quietly traveled to Venezuela last month as efforts to bring home Americans wrongfully detained there continue.

entries.title: Russia claims the contested town is under its control amid intense fighting. Its significance in military terms is minimal, but could help Moscow change path.
entries.description:
• CNN speaks to Ukrainians on front line of battle
• Russia releases US Navy veteran

entries.title: CNN reporter walks through historic Selma devastated by deadly storm
entries.description: Recovery efforts continue after severe storms swept the South and damaged power lines, severed tree limbs and sent debris flying into streets in Alabama, Georgia and Kentucky, where at least 35 preliminary tornado reports were recorded, according to the Storm Prediction Center. CNN's Ryan Young reports from Selma, Alabama.

entries.title: Must-watch videos of the week
US carrier strike group begins operating in South China Sea as tensions with China simmer
entries.description: A US carrier strike group began operating in the South China Sea on Thursday, the Navy announced, amid heightened tensions with Beijing, which claims much of the body of water as its sovereign territory.

entries.title: The first Orient Express cruise ship will set sail in 2026
entries.description: Around 140 years after making its debut as one of the most luxurious trains in the world, the iconic Orient Express is branching out into the cruising world.

entries.title: Why Biden's documents call for a special counsel
entries.description: We will all need to be patient now that former Maryland US attorney Robert Hur has been appointed by US Attorney General Merrick Garland as the special counsel in charge of the investigation into the classified documents found at President Joe Biden's home and private office from his time as vice president.

entries.title: Ukrainian troops still on edge of Soledar, a soldier tells CNN
See how Republicans downplayed Trump classified documents, but pounced on Biden
entries.description: CNN looks at how both Republicans and Democrats reacted to the mishandling of classified documents by President Joe Biden and former President Donald Trump.

entries.title: Why an Arab nation has opted to teach the Holocaust in its schools
entries.description: The United Arab Emirates will soon become the first Arab nation to teach the horrors of the Nazi Holocaust in its schools, a historic move that has been praised in some quarters -- but also criticized in others.

entries.title: Pepsi is changing its Zero Sugar recipe
entries.description: Pepsi Zero Sugar will soon taste different.

entries.title: Christina Applegate to make her first awards show appearance since MS diagnosis
entries.description: Christina Applegate says she's a bit nervous about taking to the red carpet this weekend.

entries.title: Tesla cuts prices in the US and Europe. Shares fall
Rihanna addresses new music hysteria in Super Bowl teaser
entries.description: It's been more than six years since Rihanna has released an album, and the roar of demand from fans for new music is deafening.

entries.title: How to re-start your New Year's resolutions
entries.description: It's that time of year again.

entries.title: Schumer: Biden handling of classified docs is 'complete contrast' to Trump
entries.description: Sen. Chuck Schumer (D-NY) joins "CNN This Morning" to discuss the naming of a special counsel by Attorney General Merrick Garland following the discovery of classified documents at President Biden's Delaware home and in an office he used as vice president in Washington.

entries.title: Justice Department wants to talk to people hired to search Trump properties for classified docs
entries.description: The Justice Department is seeking to question two people who searched Donald Trump's properties in November, as federal investigators have asked whether the former president returned all classified documents to the federal government, sources familiar with the probe tell CNN.

entries.title: CNN reports from trench near Soledar as Russia claims capture of town
entries.description: Ukraine is refuting a Russian claim that their forces have captured the town of Soledar in the Donbas region of eastern Ukraine. The battle for the city carries symbolic significance as its capture would be the first Russian victory in months. CNN's Ben Wedeman reports.

entries.title: Bestselling writer Colleen Hoover apologizes for planned coloring book based on domestic violence novel
entries.description: Bestselling author Colleen Hoover apologized for a planned coloring book based on her novel about domestic violence, "It Ends with Us," following criticism from readers, and announced that the project will be canceled.

entries.title: One thing you need in your kitchen to make cooking so much easier
entries.description: Before there were Crock-Pots and Instant Pots, slow cookers and air fryers, there was the Dutch oven. A multipurpose pot that has been a workhorse for cooks for centuries, it is one of the most useful, versatile pieces of kitchen equipment one can own.

entries.title: Why is Friday the 13th unlucky? The cultural origins of an enduring superstition
entries.description: When it comes to bad luck, there are few superstitions as pervasive in Western culture as that of Friday the 13th. Like crossing paths with a black cat and breaking a mirror, the notion of a day that can bring misfortune is deeply embedded — even if believers can't quite explain why.

entries.title: Tim Cook agrees to a massive pay cut
entries.description: Apple CEO Tim Cook has agreed to cut his pay this year after shareholders rebelled.

entries.title: Why no Pi? Variants are still stuck on Omicron even as coronavirus continues to mutate
entries.description: You may have heard that there's a new Omicron spinoff that's quickly gaining ground in the United States. Maybe you wanted to ask your doctor about it or search for more information online -- but what was it called again?

entries.title: Why Goldman Sachs isn't too worried about a recession
entries.description: America's largest financial institutions are pivoting into a new industry: Meteorology.

entries.title: Ukrainian doctors remove unexploded grenade from injured soldier's chest
entries.description: An injured Ukrainian soldier had an unexploded grenade successfully removed from his chest earlier this week, according to the country's military doctors.

entries.title: Aging, outdated technology leaves air travel at risk of meltdown
entries.description: The massively disruptive computer outage at the Federal Aviation Administration this week that caused thousands of cancelled or delayed flights has put Americans uncomfortably face-to-face with the technology behind US air travel — for at least the second time in a month.

entries.title: Tesla cuts prices in the US and Europe. Shares fall
entries.description: Tesla has slashed prices on its electric vehicles in the United States and Europe by as much as 20%, extending a strategy of aggressive discounting after missing Wall Street estimates for 2022 deliveries.

entries.title: Fate and metrics agree: This could be the Buffalo Bills' year
entries.description: I still remember it like it was yesterday. The Buffalo Bills took a playoff lead with 16 seconds left on the clock, and then ... they blew it.

entries.title: 82-year-old finally gets to retire after going viral on TikTok
entries.description: 82 year old Warren "Butch" Marion was able to retire after a TikTok user started a GoFundMe that raised over $100,000.

entries.title: Shaquille O'Neal makes good on promise and eats frog's legs after TCU blowout loss
entries.description: Shaquille O'Neal is many things, but you cannot say he goes back on his promises.

entries.title: Recent days saw competing claims over who controlled Soledar
entries.description: Russian forces have taken the town of Soledar in eastern Ukraine, according to Russia's defense ministry, in what would be Moscow's first significant victory in months.

entries.title: Analysis: Why Kevin McCarthy won't call on George Santos to resign
entries.description: New York Rep. George Santos doesn't seem to be going anywhere. Despite being caught in many lies and local Republicans (specifically the Nassau County GOP) calling on him to resign, Santos still has the backing of House Speaker Kevin McCarthy.

entries.title: Bosch to invest $1 billion in EV parts factory in China
entries.description: Bosch, the German engineering and technology company, is planning to invest $1 billion to make components for new energy vehicles in China, the world's largest car market.

entries.title: Keenan Anderson, cousin of Black Lives Matter founder dies from cardiac arrest after being tased by Los Angeles police
entries.description: A 31-year-old father and English teacher died from cardiac arrest last week after he was repeatedly tased by police, according to the Los Angeles Police Department, marking the third officer-involved death in the city this year.

entries.title: The best islands in Europe for getting away from almost everyone
entries.description: From legendary nightlife hotspots to volcanic outposts far off the continent's mainland, Europe has islands in spades. But for every Mykonos, Ibiza or Santorini, there's someplace lesser known and equally lovely to escape to where you can ditch the crowds and get closer to nature.

entries.title: Derek Carr bids farewell to Las Vegas Raiders and fans in letter
entries.description: NFL quarterback Derek Carr announced his departure from the Las Vegas Raiders after nine years with the franchise in an emotional letter to the team's fans.

entries.title: Sweden finds the largest rare earth deposit in Europe. It could help cut dependence on China
entries.description: Swedish mining company LKAB says it has found Europe's largest deposit of rare earth oxides in the country's north, a discovery that could reduce the continent's reliance on China for the critical resource.

entries.title: Teenage 'phenom' and high school student Alyssa Thompson selected No. 1 in NWSL draft
entries.description: Teenage sensation and high school student Alyssa Thompson was selected with the No. 1 overall pick of the National Women's Soccer League (NWSL) Draft on Thursday.

entries.title: Thailand welcomes back Chinese tourists with 'arms wide open' as key market returns
entries.description: For years, Thailand welcomed legions of Chinese tourists to its golden beaches, shopping districts and striking temples.

entries.title: Trump Org. to be sentenced on Friday after conviction for tax schemes
entries.description: Two Trump Organization entities will be sentenced by a New York judge on Friday for running a decade-long tax fraud scheme, a symbolic moment because it is the only judgment for a criminal conviction that has come close to former President Donald Trump.

entries.title: CNN speaks to Navalny's team as 2-year anniversary of his arrest nears
entries.description: As the two year anniversary of Alexey Navalny's arrest nears, CNN speaks to the Russian opposition figure's team about how his anti-war position and his continued defiance against Russian President Putin puts Navalny in a race against time with the Russian president. The award-winning CNN Film "Navalny" airs Saturday at 9 p.m. ET.

entries.title: Five famous artworks that were accidentally hung upside-down
entries.description: Art will always inspire and provoke, but it also continues to baffle and confound. To kick off the New Year, we look at some of the lighter examples of a world turned upside-down, with even some of the most experienced curators not quite getting the hang of it.

entries.title: Buffalo Bills' possible AFC Championship game against Kansas City Chiefs will be held in Atlanta
entries.description: The NFL has announced Atlanta as the host city for the AFC Championship game should the Buffalo Bills and Kansas City Chiefs meet in the conference title game.

entries.title: Sri Lanka's top court orders former president to compensate 2019 Easter bombings victims
entries.description: Sri Lanka's Supreme Court on Thursday found the country's former President Maithripala Sirisena and four other senior government officials responsible for failing to prevent the 2019 Easter bombings that killed at least 290 people and injured hundreds.

entries.title: Ostrich eggs up to 7,500 years old found next to ancient fire pit in Israel
entries.description: A well-known riddle compares an egg to treasure, asking: A box without hinges, key or a lid, yet inside golden treasure is hid. What am I?

entries.title: Fighting raged in the contested town in eastern Ukraine in 'a difficult state of the war,' the official said
entries.description:
• CNN speaks to Ukrainians on front line of battle
• Russia releases US Navy veteran

entries.title: Frustration is rising over Covid drug shortages in China, and there are no easy answers
China's exports plunge, but trade with Russia hits record high
entries.description: China reported a record trade surplus for 2022, as its key export sector delivered robust growth for most of last year, providing much-needed support for the world's second largest economy that's hammered by its zero-Covid policy.

entries.title: Japan indicts man suspected of murdering former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe
entries.description: Japanese prosecutors on Friday said they have indicted a man suspected of murdering former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe's murder suspect, the Nara Prefecture prosecutors' office said Friday.

entries.title: Ukraine claims Russian forces 'suffering heavy losses' as fighting rages around eastern town of Soledar
Brazil police find draft decree intended to overturn election result in former Bolsonaro minister's home
Draft decree to overturn Brazil election result found in former Bolsonaro minister's home
entries.description: Brazilian police searching the house of former President Jair Bolsonaro's justice minister found a draft decree proposing the introduction of a state of defense to overturn the result of the country's presidential election, the ministry's spokeswoman told CNN.

entries.title: More than 30 tornadoes reportedly hit several US states, killing at least 6 people in Alabama
entries.description: Severe storms swept across the South on Thursday, where ferocious winds sent residents running for cover, blew roofs off homes and killed at least six people in Alabama.

entries.title: Boeing 737 Max 8 takes off in China for the first time since 2019
entries.description: A Boeing 737 Max 8 took off in China on Friday, for the first time since the government grounded all 737 Max 8 planes in 2019, according to the flight tracking website, Flightradar24.

entries.title: Internet sleuths fill social media with theories and misinformation about Idaho killings
entries.description: Would-be internet sleuths are filling social media with theories and misinformation surrounding the University of Idaho killings. CNN's Gary Tuchman reports.

entries.title: World's top chip maker mulls global expansion with plants in Europe, Japan
entries.description: Semiconductor giant Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC) may expand its global manufacturing footprint even further.

entries.title: Remembering Lisa Marie Presley: A life in the spotlight
entries.description: As the only daughter of the late Elvis Presley and Priscilla Presley, singer Lisa Marie Presley spent her life in the spotlight from the start.

entries.title: Video: Gallery owner sprays unhoused woman with water in San Francisco
entries.description: A San Francisco business owner is under scrutiny after a video of him spraying an unhoused woman with a water hose went viral.

entries.title: The only child of the late Elvis Presley and Priscilla Presley died after she suffered cardiac arrest and was hospitalized
Misogynistic 'alpha male' influencer Andrew Tate's deal with the right-wing social media site Rumble is worth millions, he has privately said
entries.description: Andrew Tate has been lining his pockets via right-wing social media.

entries.title: Starbucks tells corporate employees to return to office 3 days a week
entries.description: Corporate workers at Starbucks must return to the office at least three days a week by the end of January, interim CEO Howard Schultz announced in a Wednesday memo, as another corporate giant clamps down on remote work.

entries.title: The world's longest river cruise will sail India's Ganges
entries.description: A luxury ship will make history when it embarks from the Indian spiritual city of Varanasi on Friday on a voyage that the country's leader says will help usher in a new age of tourism on the subcontinent.

entries.title: Biden's whirlwind final days as VP had aides scrambling to close his White House office
entries.description: • Analysis: White House missteps exacerbated Biden's classified documents headache

entries.title: 'People are gonna die in the street': City official gets heated at meeting
entries.description: Blow back from Revere, Massachusetts residents over a proposal to use the city's senior center as an overnight warming shelter draws a fiery response from City Councilor Marc Silvestri. CNN Affiliate WCVB reports.

entries.title: Lisa Marie Presley has died
Biden's whirlwind final days as vice president had aides scrambling to close his White House office
CNN reporters describe seeing Lisa Marie Presley days before death
entries.description: Lisa Marie Presley, daughter of late Elvis Presley, has died, her mother confirmed in a statement. She was 54-years-old. CNN's Chloe Melas and Stephanie Elam share their perspective after seeing her at the Golden Globes just days earlier.

entries.title: Singer Lisa Marie Presley, daughter of Elvis Presley, dead at 54
Hear what some Russians think about Putin's invasion
entries.description: CNN's Frederik Pleitgen reports that while Vladimir Putin's war in Ukraine is heating up, it's getting a frosty reception from many Russians in Moscow.

entries.title: Paul Ryan says he 'had too much power' as House speaker
New York City man pleads guilty to hate crime in death of Asian man, district attorney says
entries.description: More than a year after an Asian man died after being assaulted in New York City, Jarrod Powell pleaded guilty in his death and will serve 22 years in prison, the Manhattan District Attorney's Office announced Thursday.

entries.title: See the damage left after powerful storms move across Southeast US
entries.description: CNN's Jennifer Gray reports on the powerful storms that left a trail of damage throughout the Southeast.

entries.title: 'If this is not an invasion, what is?': Gov. Abbott responds to criticism over letter
entries.description: Republican Texas Gov. Greg Abbott speaks with CNN's Jake Tapper and responds to criticism by the Dallas Morning News editorial board that his letter to President Joe Biden about migrants portrays them as "enemy combatants".

entries.title: Hong Kong businesses cheer China reopening, but warn there's a long way to go
What is bacterial meningitis, the disease that killed Jeff Beck?
entries.description: After contracting bacterial meningitis, legendary rock guitarist Jeff Beck died Wednesday at the age of 78, according to a statement posted to his official social media accounts and confirmed to CNN by his agent.
